mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Rafinesque, C. S. (Constantine Samuel), 1783-1840
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Sends own French pamphlet on botany and zoology; has found new tree, genus "Virgilia fragilis," or yellow locust; will grow in Virginia; sends pods; has not heard from University of Virginia about readiness to open, and assumes his liberal offer was not accepted; will endow Transylvania University with his collections of 30,000 specimens of plants, animals and minerals.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1822 September 24, Lexington, Kentucky, to Th[oma]s Jefferson, Monticello, [Albemarle County, Virginia].
